bestBHT.bht: Jesus reveals that He will refrain from drinking the fruit of the vine until the day when He partakes of it anew, representing the joys of heaven. This hints at a future where God will reign in the saints, and they will enjoy His presence for all eternity. Emphasizing that the next time He drinks, it will not be of this earthly realm but in the heavenly kingdom, Jesus highlights the eternal nature of His joy and the transformative experience that lies ahead.

John Gill: I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine; that is, wine, until that day that I drink it new; in a figurative and mystical sense; by which are meant the joys of heaven."
By which are meant the joys of heaven.
God, Father, Son, and Spirit, will be all in all, and shall reign in the saints, and they with them, to all eternity.
John Wesley: I will drink no more of the fruit of the vine, till I drink it new in the kingdom of God."
That is, I shall drink no more before I die."
The next wine I drink will not be earthly, but heavenly.

bhtAttempts.bht: Jesus declares in this verse that He will not partake in the fruit of the vine until the day when He drinks it anew. This signifies a figurative and mystical sense, representing the joys of heaven. It foreshadows the time when God will be all in all, reigning in the saints for all eternity. Jesus reveals that the next time He partakes of the wine, it will not be of this earthly realm, but in the kingdom of God.

Jesus declares that He will refrain from drinking the fruit of the vine until the day when He partakes of it anew. This signifies the joys of heaven, representing a figurative and mystical sense. It hints at a future where God will reign in the saints, and they will enjoy His presence for all eternity. Jesus emphasizes that the next time He drinks, it will not be of this earthly realm but in the heavenly kingdom, highlighting the eternal nature of His joy.

Jesus proclaims that He will abstain from the fruit of the vine until the day when He drinks it anew, symbolizing the joys of heaven. This points to an eternal reign wherein God will be all in all, and believers will partake in His everlasting presence. By linking the cessation of drinking to the kingdom of God, Jesus conveys that His next consumption will transcend earthly realms, revealing a heavenly and everlasting fulfillment. His declaration underscores the transformative nature of His future divine banquets.

Jesus reveals that He will refrain from drinking the fruit of the vine until the day when He partakes of it anew, representing the joys of heaven. This hints at a future where God will reign in the saints, and they will enjoy His presence for all eternity. Emphasizing that the next time He drinks, it will not be of this earthly realm but in the heavenly kingdom, Jesus highlights the eternal nature of His joy and the transformative experience that lies ahead.

Jesus declares that He will abstain from the fruit of the vine until the day when He partakes of it anew, signifying the joys of heaven. This alludes to a future when God will reign in the saints and they will share in His eternal rule. The next time Jesus drinks, it will not be of this earthly realm but in the heavenly kingdom, portraying the everlasting nature of His joyous communion. This statement underscores the transformative and heavenly reality awaiting His followers.
